alert.note: Alert for South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 2:21PM MST until March 04 at 7:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON... .An upper level storm system brings windy conditions on Friday afternoon. The strong and gusty southwesterly winds will combine with low relative humidity below 15%, and above normal temperatures. This will result in elevated to critical fire weather conditions for portions of southwestern and south-central New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MST FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 110, 111, AND 112... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 110, 111 and 112. * WIND...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
